title: Crochet Book Collection [Epub, PDF]
description:
Crochet Book Collection- 15 ebooks for all skill levels 
1. ALL- 100 Quick and Easy Crochet Stitches/ Darla Sims (Annie's)- PDF
2. ALL- The Crocheter's Companion/ Nancy Brown (Interweave)- PDF
3. BEG- Getting Started Crochet/ Judith L Swartz (Interweave)- Epub
4. BEG- It's So Easy- crochet fashions & accesssories/ Annie's- PDF
5. BEG- Learn Drop Stitch Crochet/ Kim Guzman (Annie's)- PDF
6. BEG-INT- Best of Interweave Crochet/ Marcy Smith (Interweave)- Epub
7. BEG-INT- Clever Crocheted Accessories/ Brett Bara (Interweave)- Epub
8. BEG-INT- Crochet at Home/ Interweave- Epub
9. BEG-INT- Elegant, Fashionable, Chic Accessories to Crochet/ Annie's- PDF
10.INT-Animal Amigurumi to Crochet/ Teri Crews (Annie's)- PDF
11.INT- Baby Blueprint Crochet/ Robyn Chachula (Interweave)- Epub
12.INT- Crochet Me/ Kim Werker (Interweave)- Epub
13.INT- Crocheted Gifts/ Kim Werker (Interweave)- Epub
14.INT- Double Stitch/ Erika & Monika Simmons (Interweave)- Epub
15.INT-Unexpected Afghans/ Robyn Chachula (Interweave)- Epub

Readers Required:
PDF- Adobe Digital Editions, Adobe Reader (PC,Android, ipad, iphone), load as a document into Kindle
Epub- Adobe Digital Editions, Calibre, MoonReader for Android phones and tablets
Conversion: Epub can be converted to mobi (Kindle) with Calibre 
Tested on Calibre, ADE and Adobe Reader with no problems.
Please allow a couple seconds for the seedboxes to kick in. 
Enjoy and let's get crafty! :D
_______________________________________________________________________________

Description from Getting Started Crochet (BEG):
Neophyte crafters learn how to wield a crochet hook with skill and grace, enter yarn stores with confidence, and recreate their favorite crochet trends in this invaluable guide. Seemingly complex crocheting jargon and techniques are demystified with step-by-step photographs and instructions. Clear diagrams demonstrate how to hold a crochet hook and yarn, and form basic stitches to create a simple scarf. More advanced skills - such as shaping, working in rounds, motifs, and edging - lead into sophisticated projects, including an evening bag, a pillow, and an edged camisole. Designed for the extreme beginner, the manual also contains an index, a list of additional resources, and helpful charts.

Description from Crocheted Gifts: Irresistible Projects to Make and Give (INT):
Make stylish crocheted gifts year-round with Crocheted Gifts, a collection of projects from today's most popular crochet designers. From baby gifts to mittens for the whole family, to home decor and fancy lace, this book is full of perfect projects for every occasion.

The first small project book to focus exclusively on crochet, Crocheted Gifts is the ultimate gift-giving guide resource for crocheters, full of various projects that crocheters will love to make and be proud to give away (if they can bear to part with them!).

Featuring 25 designs by various crochet stars such as Doris Chan, Kathy Merrick, Robyn Chachula, Annie Modesitt, and more, Crocheted Gifts includes innovative, unusual, and imaginative designs for all crochet tastes. Crocheted Gifts also includes stylish photography and step-by-step crochet instructions for every project, ranging from easy-to-crochet to more advanced techniques.
